Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AnkaraSunshine
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets your every expectation from a modern city hotel (including lack of character!). But the best thing is its location. Most first-timers in Istanbul head to the over-touristed old city to stay. Titanic Port is a short-ish taxi ride from the main airport, but it's not an out-of-town, out-of-way airport hotel. It's located in a wonderful, buzzing, middle-class Turkish neighborhood. Nearby there are some old Ottoman mansions, Armenian churches, shopping streets, cafes, seafood restaurants, malls, and a marina. All of this within walking distance. If the weather is good, the streets will be buzzing with young people. Great way to explore Turkish way of life. And the obvious old city sights are still a taxi ride away. If you prefer to be among Istanbulites instead, take a taxi to the nearby Yesilyurt and have a great day on the promenade or the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good but lacking personality”
Reviews.Author: FoxM64
Reviews.Content: Western kind of hotel, with all comforts and perks. Decent service but not really that "turkish". Like more the Swisshotel on the Bosphorus

Reviews.Title: “Additional help by the Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: 911BorisP
Reviews.Content: I was in urgent need to source the best overnight delivery provider to the USA. Language was a very big barrier as none of providers had an agent who could speak English. Ms. Elif Timur from the Reception has done an outstanding job in sourcing the best provider. She has involved herself considerably to find solution in a timely manner best suiting my requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffapple
Reviews.Content: A 5 star hotel near Ataturk Airport in Istanbul. From beginning to end : PERFECT. Staff are amazingly helpful, polite and supportive. Rooms are spacious, modern with very comfortable beds and pillows. Meals were tasty, enjoyable whether buffet or off regular menu. This hotel was well organized, even though only open 1 month. Indoor and outdoor swimming pools with full spa. Sipped tea after our indoor swim. Only at hotel 1 night on way out of Istanbul. What an amazing surprise. Would love to go back in a heartbeat. Not a single complaint. Best to book on line to keep costs down. The Titanic hotel was unforgettably great.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to visit Istanbul for first time”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: This is a really brilliant hotel and outstanding value. It was recommended by a friend and I am really glad to have found it. It is one of the few hotels to offer a free return shuttle service from the airport, which worked seamlessly. Although it is quite far out of the centre of Istanbul, it is only a taxi ride or a couple of metro rides away. Taxi will cost about TRY 25 each way while the metro only costs TRY 4 each way (Ok, it does involve a bit of a schlep to walk to the Metro station but this is no biggie). The hotel is extremely quiet as it is located in a residential area. Staff are very pleasant and efficient and standards generally are exceptionally high. The breakfast is incredible; a huge variety of freshly-prepared hot and cold foods makes this a real highlight of one's stay here. The views from the bar on the top floor, especially at night, are lovely. Lots of upmarket shopping a few metres away at the Carousel and Capa City shopping centres.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: KBupminster
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with excellent staff. We had a very pleasant stay recently and if we were to visit Istanbul again, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Titanic Port Hotel: Amazing Istanbul Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Randall P
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough! I was leaving Iraq and going home to the USA and had to spend the night in Istanbul. I was looking for a nice hotel with a world class spa. After reading several reviews I took a chance and picked the Titanic Port Hotel. What an awesome experience I had! The staff is outstanding! And I can't say enough about the Guest Relations Rep, Aylin Kutay. She went out of here way to make me feel welcome and ensured all my needs were met. The room was a pleasant surprise. Clean, spacious, well stocked and extremely comfortable. I went down stairs to their gym and was pleasantly surprised at how clean and modern the equipment was. After the gym I treated myself to a visit to the hotels spa and LOVED it! Got an awesome massage, pedicure and a facial that was one of the best I had every had. I can't say enough about this hotel. I highly recommend it and you will not be disappointed! Randy Powers

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: brunello44
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant hotel stay! Everything about this place was wonderfully agreeable. The room was very nice, with a large, comfortable bed, a sofa, a large closet, and good lighting. The bathroom had a very large shower, which was particularly nice. The ground floor has both a restaurant and a quick coffee shop, and we appreciated having both. I can't say enough about the staff -- extremely helpful, nice and friendly. The head of guest services went out of her way to greet and welcome us personally. Logistically, the property is immediately adjacent to a big shopping mall and is just a few minutes walk to the train that goes to the Topkapi Palace / Grand Bazaar / Spice Market areas. Lots of food choices in walking distance. Metered, licensed taxis are queued at the hotel entrance 24/7 -- yes, even at 03.30. The ride to Ataturk airport was no more than 12-15 minutes. Overall, one just has to wonder why other hotels can't get these things right. The Titanic Port is nothing fancy. It's nothing glamorous. It just gets everything right and creates a very pleasant environment for its guests. They just take care to make guests happy & comfortable. Kudos to management & staff!

Reviews.Title: “A Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Christine G
Reviews.Content: It was the first time that I stayed in the hotel, but what a surprise! The rooms are comfortable and nice, the service just wonderful and the fitness area is amazing! I'll come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: RahulRangnekar
Reviews.Content: Very good business hotel. Away from the usual tourist destinations. Very good rooms, good and helpful staff. Good bar and restaurant. Will definitely like to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Titanic Port Hotel Ok for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Givi_81
Reviews.Content: Good for business if you have to stay in this part of the City. One of the best fitness center I have seen around. Good quality of wi-fi connection. Rooms are clean, that's one of most important things. It is also good if you need to go to Asian side, since Bakirkoy ferry terminal is located 5 minutes walking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relationship with the guest”
Reviews.Author: Cypriot_family
Reviews.Content: This is the First time we stay at that Hotel. Ä°t is possible to relax, very clean rooms, perfect breakfast, XL beds, and very confotable.

Reviews.Title: “Very average stay, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: NightWhispers
Reviews.Content: One thing that irks me about any hotel is their lack of preparedness. As most of my trips bring me into my destinations early morning I get a good chance to gauge a hotel service simply by seeing how ready they are...to receive me... should be something any traveller should look forward to, right ? After a very tiring 5 hour flight, and having to put up with the usual "let us sleep" extremely irritated attitude of the night crew of the airline that brought me into Istanbul, I was picked up by my hosts and whisked off to this hotel. The first thing that strikes you when you pull up to this hotel is that it looks like a really practical place to stay. Unfortunately that's sort of all you can say about it. OK, so it's 6:45 am, I've just been flying for 5 hours, taken a good part of 2 hours to get out of the airport, with another 35 minute drive down Istanbul's refreshingly fast causeways, skimming through heavy trucks and signs of morning rush hour traffic starting to form, and we get to this hotel... Guess what ? My room's not ready... I'm always cautiously optimistic whenever I come to Turkey. It's a great place to visit, Turks are quite friendly, but their service industry is playing catch up really slowly... That's irritating. After pleading with the receptionists (who don't smile by the way...) they huffingly sat me down, and by 7:40, I was up to my room... With their senior receptionist reminding me in a friendly way to remember this favor (!) they did me by breezing me up to the room with lightning speed.... The rooms are OK, reminiscent of the old Sheraton designs, quite adequate in terms of facilities but they have no bathtubs in this hotel it seems, one thing that strikes you if you get a room close to the elevator is what a difference it makes in terms of noise... Try it and you'll see, you can hear the elevators coming up and down there. It was quite cold when I arrived but when I got into my room the heater (which you can't control) was so stuffy I had to open a window to stop my head from exploding... That helped a bit although it let in some of the traffic noise, the fact that I was on a high floor did help. In sharp contrast to the lobby size, this hotel is BIG. Entering it does not show but it has so many twists and turns you can easily get lost simply by going up the wrong staircase. What got to me the most about my stay at this hotel was the fact that the staff was downright unfriendly. I wouldn't say they were rude but they definitely lacked the warm smile you can find in some other places. This is reflected everywhere, restaurant staff, bar staff, reception, the security looks like they would jump you for asking for a second helping of marmalade... Their breakfast is quite good, I recommend trying anything turkish they have set out on the table as it's quite authentic and well worth the taste... So I missed my flight out and had to extend my stay for one night, would they give me the rate my hosts had ? nope... Call them and get them to send us a fax (even emails wouldn't do) their senior receptionist (someone I'm going to call...aunty...) commanded...OK, did that, fine, it was extended, well and good for me. Late checkout at this hotel ? Sure, all of an extra half an hour for you... One if you beg really really hard... At the end of the second day here, I just packed my bags, got into a tour bus and spent the rest of the day seeing Istanbul. This hotel just wasn't worth any more effort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money & good airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterEmmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. The rooms are very comfortable with quality bathroom fittings and a huge bed. Complimentary tea / coffee making facilities and free Wifi were also provided and the free airport shuttle was great. The breakfast was one of the best Turkish buffet breakfasts I have had with good food and plenty of choice. The price is very reasonable for the level of comfort & service provided. It has a large gym in the basement & a spa. My only minor criticism was that the roof top restaurant was closed due to a private party & neither the choice of food in the ground floor restaurant, nor the two outside restuarants suggested by the hotel staff appealed to us. Under normal circumstances this would not have been a a problem as we would have gone out and explored the local area. However, it was bitterly cold & wet & we really struggled to find good food in the evening. Having said that I would definitely stay here again if I wanted to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrick T
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Titanic Port hotel in Jan 2012. The rooms are very nice, spacious with excellent amenities and a very modern decor. The staff is very helpful and gracious. The breakfast buffet is excellent with a huge variety of items. The free airport shuttle is great. Be aware that you will want working cellphone/email service, though. We arrived on AtlasJet (only 10m late), but because it took a very long time to get our luggage, the hotel shuttle had waited an hour and given up on us. We didn't know this, and ended up waiting another hour before giving up and taking a taxi. When I finally got WiFi at the hotel, I discovered plenty attempts to contact me, so they tried and were very apologetic when I finally arrived. But be aware the shuttle is not one of the "every half hour" but the "I'll call and he'll come" variety. There is a lot of shopping (two malls) right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VoulaTzeveleki
Reviews.Content: Service orientated and friendly staff, great value for money, perfect location near shopping malls, pedestrians, trendy restaurants in nearby Atakoy and just 10 minutes drive to Ataturk International airport.

Reviews.Title: “Titanic Port Hotel Bakirkoy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tug O
Reviews.Content: Friendly, slick and neat service. From the breakfast to the taxi services the whole hotel was simply a class act. I wanted to thank you all @Titanic Port Hotel (Bakirkoy) for enabling a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Marcellecas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and would highly recomend this Hotel. The rooms were stylish, comfortable and clear the breakfast was absolutely delicious the staff were top class and liked the fact that there was a cool shopping mall next door. I would not nessessarly stay here for a holiday- I was here on business, but would definately stay again when next in Istanbul on business and the free airport shuttle is another bonus thanks for reading this review

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed_Rahim
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff are the worst you can see, but the hotel is great

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JusraCibaku
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 2 weeks in october 2011 as we had 3 persons at acibadem hospital which is near this hotel and the rates were ok related others in the area also the service and amenties, the hotel is near a shooping center. enjoy and have e great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for short stay if you want to stay close to the Ataturk airport”
Reviews.Author: CD04-Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be of a very good quality the facilities were very good and breakfast was very good. The shower was in the bathroom was excellent, its probably the best shower i had in any hotel in Turkey. We also liked the fact that the hotel provideed a shuttle bus service, that picked us up from the airport and dropped us off at the airport when we checked out. Please note, this shuttle needs to be organised when booking your stay. Also there is a major shopping centre next to the hotel for last minute shopping.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good....”
Reviews.Author: docbob2596
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this hotel , by my 50th or so stay in Istanbul. New modern hotel, a bit clinical in reception, but very efficient. Room most comfortable, and well equipped. Location close to airport does mean it commands a slightly higher price, and hotel food is never cheap in cities, but here, the food quality left you happy to pay that wee bit more than you'd expect. Staff excellent, Only grumble.. do we really need Titanic runnign 24/7 on channel 2? over all a good place to stay, there are better places location wise, in Istanbul, but certainly this one can be easily recommended if yo need a hotel in the airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Excellent Service, Superior Rooms, and Spotless”
Reviews.Author: allanc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on October 10. We arrived at 9AM. We had requested that the hotel shuttle service pick us up at the airport and we asked if it was possible to get a room so early. We were pleasantly surprised-the shuttle was waiting for us as we exited the airport and our room was readay. The room was spotlessly clean. We found the staff and especially the concierge extremely accomodating. The hotel room was very well appointed and extremely comfortable. We had and early flight the next morning and the location was perfect for the airport. The hotel is located in a good area close to two shopping centres and many shops. The train station is 3 blocks away-the trains go to Sirkeci (Sultanhamet, Karakoy, etc). station frequently. We had originally booked at another hotel and were so glad that we changed to the Titanic Port. I highly recommend the Titantic Port Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & great location to airport, but...”
Reviews.Author: Faros
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night on October 1st. This was our last night of a two week vacation thru Turkey and Greece. We wanted to stay close to the airport to avoid any traffic problems. The location was perfect - it took us 10 minutes to get to the terminal in the morning. The hotel is modern and the rooms are very spacious and very comfortable. We had a bit of a problem with the shower not draining properly but it was mostly our lack of knowledge of the drain system. Look it over before you shower. The breakfast buffet, which was included in the price of the room, was absolutely amazing. Wonderful fruits, yogurts, cereals, breads and pastries, eggs several ways, hams, cheeses, etc. The buffet starts at 6:30 AM so you don't have to worry about rushing to catch your flight back to the US at noon. The only disappointment I had was with the staff at the front desk and at the door. They weren't rude, nor were they friendly. The front desk neglected to inform me that a password was needed for internet, and you have to come downstairs to get it in person. I found that out after getting settled into the room and changing into my PJs. So get dressed again and back downstairs. And when we decided to carry our own bags to our rooms, the staff essentially ignored us, as if we weren't even there. Overall, a fine place to stay for one night in transit to the airport... a fabulous breakfast and a very nice room. The people... well, not quite as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: H0meFree
Reviews.Content: Pros: The location of the hotel is excellent. Not far from the airport, and it is situated in a live area, many shopping centers around within walking distance. The waterfront & Galleria Mall is within walking distance as well, although that waterfron is not as exciting as Eminonu waterfornt. Cons: The hotel staff are not as friendly as you would expect in any 5-star hotel. They lack the basics of hotel management and service. Most of the staff do not speak english, and those who do, speak very poor english. The reception staff are unqualified for the job as they failed to attend my requests on time everytime I call them. One time, we were out of facial tissues, so I called the receptionist asking for a pack of tissues, and he said that they would take care of that. I had to call two more times to remind him and after 45 minutes of the first call I received the tissues. In addition, the Air Conditioning of the room was terrible, although weather outside the hotel was nice. My 6-month-old daughter was sweating in the baby cot with minimal clothes. When we asked them to check it out, they said there was nothing wrong with the A/C!

Reviews.Title: “Regular customer”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I often make a stopover in Istanbul. We are regular guests at the Titanic Port Hotel in BakirkÃ¶y for some years and we always look forward to our overnight stay. The hotel is conveniently located close to AttatÃ¼rk International Airport and just within a short and nice taxi drive to Istanbul City Center. We enjoy the neighbouring shopping malls, street shops and restaurants. The hotel lobby is pleasant and well arranged adjacent to the restaurant and the bar. Service is irreproachable and guestrooms are clean, nicely furnished and well equipped. The breakfast buffet is excellent though the coffee could be somewhat warmer. It's a nice hotel that I would like to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We loved, good staff, nice hotel, clean rooms, we will planned stay again”
Reviews.Author: vugar a
Reviews.Content: We loved, good staff, nice hotel, clean rooms, we will planned stay again! Location super, 10 minutes from airport, 3 big mall near the this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in BakirkÃ¶y”
Reviews.Author: MartinVF
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the Titanic Port Hotel. The rooms are ecellent, gym nice and big and it has excellent breakfast. It is not smack in the middle of Istanbul but perfectly located for my business purposes. It is quite new and reminds you in style of a Marriott or other better hotels. Only problem is that the internet connection is quite slow.

Reviews.Title: “yes”
Reviews.Author: paolo004
Reviews.Content: Good Locations .... very confortable , clean and right price !

Reviews.Title: “I hope this Titanic does not sink!”
Reviews.Author: Easy14u
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel for different reasons. Whenever I travel to Istanbul even if it is just for one day I try this hotel. It gives me what I need. Comfort, easy access to sea, nearness to airport, close to cinemas and group of restaurants, close to shopping centers(my wife!) ... This last time I had a minor problem with my reservation. I do not complain but after six times in this hotel, they should have my name in their data base and they should know that I am a regular customer. I recommend this hotel to my best friend and will stay there in future.

Reviews.Title: “I can advise this hotel for those:”
Reviews.Author: tjudit
Reviews.Content: who love good location (close to everything but calm in the evening), delicious breakfast, very friendly and polite staff, clean and comfortable rooms. One of my best experiences. I enjoyed every second there. Thanks for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Location, Free Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Tripper21
Reviews.Content: Good Location in south of city, 5 miles from airport, 5 min walk to 2 shopping malls. Rooms large and well equipped, and very well serviced each day. WiFi is free, but i did have problems with dropped connections and very slow quite a few times.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, nice Hotel- come back again”
Reviews.Author: chutextil
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very nice and very comfortable. Very good service, thanks a lot to Aylin for managing it all. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent. Airport and CNR- Expo is in 15- 20 Euro Taxi- distance. A big galeria and many restaurants are in the surrounding of the hotel. I was there for business and I definitly come back for my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “very good airport hotel but air-con should be better”
Reviews.Author: StChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before a flight back home. Good location next to a shopping mall with many restaurants. Staff was eager to help you. The room had a safe, bathtub, and kettle. However the air-con did not cool down the room quite enough. There was a window that opened but no strong breeze either. We did sleep OK though. The breakfast buffet, included in our rate, was good. We did not use the business centre or the pool/spa. On departure we took the free shuttle to the airport. Overall we liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: tony1968s
Reviews.Content: Myself and two colleagues stayed on business, the rooms were large and spacious, very clean, fantastic shower, breakfast was delicious especially the HONEY. close to the sea and the airport, would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravler1946
Reviews.Content: Flew in on Sunday to Istanbul. Hotel does not have a shuttle on Sundays. Told me by e-mail that it should be about 20 TL by taxi. We did not take a taxi that was in line at the airport, but took one that was passing by. It cost 16 TL. Flight out was very early. Their shuttle didn't start until 8:00 am. Room included breakfast. Ordered box breakfasts. They were not ready, when they came back, they only had one. They said to eat in the dining room which was just setting up. We couldn't wait. They ordered a taxi. The taxi already had 2.5 TL's on the meter. When we questioned the taxi cab driver, he stated that he didn't understand. If you wanted to use the pool, you had to have a bathing cap, even for my husband who is bald. The cap cost 5 Euros!

Reviews.Title: “fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: SSpade
Reviews.Content: Basic reception area. Simple bar, odour of chips. Modern clean well equipped rooms. Shower only no bath. Good breakfast buffet. Another guest was complaining of a foul smell in his bathroom, noticed hotel response was not very concerned.Would have graded lower but for the excellent room rate which made it great value.

Reviews.Title: “They will rip you off when given the choice”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1234524
Reviews.Content: We were encouraged to have breakfast upon checking in and it was insinuated to us that it was free with the room. Instead, after having had cereal and orange juice, they charged us $100 USD. When we complained they were simply awful. There are lots of hotels near the airport. Don't choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...and I have some tips if you want to go on the cheap...”
Reviews.Author: Jammer1226
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - the room was large (maybe because we had a corner one), the bathroom was fantastic, the shower is large enough for 2, the toilet has a built in crack washer (I need to put in one of those in my house!), and the window opens. This was key because the downside was that the furnace was on and my gal and I, well, we needed the AC. That's why the sleep quality is only 4 and not 5. Can you beat free WiFi? The only food we had was Turkish coffee in the cafe and it comes with llocum (Turkish delight but you can also call a hot chick llocum or your sweetheart llocum, etc.), and breakfast in bed which was fantastic. The room service was excellent and when we called for anything else, it came in less than 5 minutes. The gym is fantastic. Plenty of cardio, free weights, and machines. I didn't go to the pool because of an ear infection nor did I try the spa because I wasn't allowed :( This is a perfect hotel if you plan on doing Istanbul on the cheap. Even though both my girl and I make very good money, we don't like to spend a lot unless we have to. First, you can easily take the train there from the airport, but the taxi is very convenient - next time I will go via train when I'm alone. Second, if you want good Turkish food, it's all around within walking distance and very cheap. We never paid more than 30 Lira for a meal with drinks and salad. Every Turkish restaurant is a sit down restaurant and not fast food like in the US. They grill things fresh, the veggies are fresh, the bread is fresh, so even when you go to the mall food court, it is a GREAT meal. There are 2 malls right next to the Titanic that have scores of great Turkish restaurants, and across the street is a huge shopping area of town that has a lot of good restaurants. Third, Migros, this is a grocery store in the basement of both malls. You can save on the 8 Lira per bottle of water at the hotel by buying the 1 Lira or less at Migros. We also bought a kilo of Baklava which lasted the 4 days we were there, and it was heavenly. Everynight with tea - you can pick a variety there at Migros. Last, the train - if you've ever taken taxis in Istanbul, the traffice sucks and the cost is high and the drivers never speak any English or don't understand very well the Turkish that you've learned. The train is the way to go as it costs 1.5 Lira to board, so getting to all the sites at Sirkeci is a breeze. From the hotel, walk to the end of the 2nd mall, take a left, and go until you see the train tracks (maybe 3 or 4 blocks total). Go up to the booth and ask for however many tokens you want (1 token = 1 ride like the subway or el). Take the train heading east and stay on until the last stop at the Sirkeci station, and you are within walking distance of all the sites. If you eat at a restaurant there versus at Bakarkoy, you will see the difference that tourists pay on food - 3 times as much! Oh, I guess I should mention the shopping because my girl is a shopping pro, and she was in heaven here between the 2 malls and all the Turkish shops across the street. She bought me a Pierre Cardin blazer for $100. If you foreget anything, you can get it in this mall. I will be booking at the Titanic everytime I travel through Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AIYAP
Reviews.Content: Titanic Port hotel is conveniently located by Istanbul, Ataturk airport, shopping, restaurants and the water. Staff is very professional and helpful. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. I stayed at this hotel once in October 2010 and once in January 2011 and quality of service was excellent. Breakfast is superb so buy it with your room! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Titanic Port Hotel - Awesome Hotel, Comfortable Rooms, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SurajSeshadri
Reviews.Content: It is located in one of the main shopping areas of Istanbul. The rooms were excellent, really spacious had a good view of the Sea of Marmara. The Bathrooms were really good and were stocked with good toilteries. The Continental breakfast was served in arranged in a spacious restaurant. Service is definately fast and staff respond well and are very friendly. Service quality is one of the best I have seen in Turkey A must stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: sharmaineyeo
Reviews.Content: I was only supposed to stay here for a night, which was disappointing, because I wanted to stay longer. So far, this is the best hotel I've stayed at so far in Turkey. Because of it's prime location in the city, I expected it to be good and my wish was granted. The lobby was cramped after all of the luggages were put there. (I was going with a tour group) There was hardly any space to walk in but the lobby was delightful and grand enough. Rooms were impressively decorated. They were pretty, classy and very excellent looking. Bathrooms had basic necessities like shampoo, soap, cotton buds etc. The room was a pleasure to sleep in, and also had a view of the city. They were spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was great, my omelette was delicious, and the pastries were baked to perfection - crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Their orange juice was freshly squeezed and not from a carton, and this fact made me even more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it, my wife a bit less”
Reviews.Author: simonsmidt
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that I was for business in Istanbul. After having stayed in the Wow hotel first, see my review of that hotel, I luckily stayed now here. Main reason for that; the bed. This one was nicely soft....the way I like it. As you have noticed from the title my wife didn't like the soft bed that much.... The room is nice and big, a comfortable bathroom, and you can open a window to let the sea breeze get in. The buffet breakfast gives a lot of choice, and I found this also better than in the Wow. As I was away most of the day and my wife stayed she had a bit more experience with the hotel itself. She also confirms the complaints about the reception staff. She had bad experiences, but also good ones; the last day they allowed her to stay until 1500 in the room as our flight was only at 1900. Also their advice on where to go where in the end correct, but the way it was delivered could be better. Probably because of a lack of English....or her Turkish ;-) I particularly liked the free internet, a rare thing amongst these high ranked hotels. The fitness was liked by my wife, and also being next to 2 shopping-malls was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: gsfg5007
Reviews.Content: Titianic Port Hotel is a new, very clean hotel with excellent service. It is near two shopping malls, ATMs, and the water. My room was big, with all the required amenities including in-room safe and minibar. Internet access was available in the room as well as two computers in their business center. It also has a nice bar (with expensive prices though). Restaurant food was very good. Bathroom very clean. Only downside is that it is not particulary close to the traditional major sightseeing attractions of Istanbul. Taxis are easy to get however, and if you are looking for a nice stay close to the airport, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PEOPLE,BEST SPA AND GYM,MODERN NEW FACILITIES...”
Reviews.Author: LauraTeresa
Reviews.Content: If you are like me that likes to be treated like a VIP then yopu must visit the Titanic Port Hotel in Istanbul. The personal all over the hotel go out of their way to help you, very friendly ...I swim and used the spinn bikes, and their gym, they even have pilates equipment, My husband and brother in law played tabletennis , the equipment at the gym is new and very modern, even counts for you the reps and they have everything you need and more... you can swim laps in the pool , EVERYTHING AT NO EXTRA COST. I also used the spa, after I met a lady from Turkey who just had a baby and was using the spa told me it is one of the bast spas in Istanbul, I got the package with the best turkeish bath polish and exfoliation (was not sure if I wanted someone to bath me, glad I tried it and loved it), then a coffe wrap thatt smelled great, and finally a massage ( I had better massages but it was not bad I guess I expected more or maybe did not choose the right one as they have many types) A beautiful steam room with a dome with some lights that change from green to blue very nice and relaxin, a real big sauna with nice aroma and the right temperature the turkish bath room with nice tiles, and two areas, one more private...the massage room very nice ecotared with a beautiful aroma too and an electric area for real confy warm towels and very nice european spa products . I have been to nice 5 star hotels like the Bellagio, the Ritz , Four seassons and the Peninsula... And although I wouldnot give 5 stars to the hotel I would give 4 ,The service and the people are certainly 5 stars, The gym is for sure better than most 5 stars, the wet room area for sure better than many five stars. So if you want to see Istanbul but also be treated great and relax at the wet area , or use their spa, or do excersice and keep fit , go for a swim...Look no further, plus you canÂ´t beat the value= ). My special Thanks to Mr.Sinan that made sure we would be received great and to ms. Aylin who just was very attentive and making sure all our need and wishes would be met. Exsamples are we would have a special request for warm soy milk and pickles and they would have it ready for us every morning ,we asked for a wheel chair for my mother in law, and again they would have it ready for us at no extra charge, we looked at the Heathrow airport and at Istanbul airport and around Istanbul for the best money exchange rate and nobody could give us better than at Titanic Port hotel gift shop, plus the guy bthere super friendly and nice, he even gave my daughter and I a little present(the prices at the gift shop the same as the Bazar and cheaper than the duty free at the aitrport (they charge you in Euros more expensive even if it says tax free). My family and my brothers in law family were going to return earlier than my old parents in law, so Titanic made sure to get them to the airport and check them in so they would not get confussed or lost!!, WOW, THANK YOU AYLIN!! And Thanks to everyone at the Titanic Port Hotel. PS Even if it is not at the center of turist atractions two blocks away is the metro that takes you directly to and from the grand bazar , sophia , the blue m... areaand it costs 1.5 lyras each way. I had to take it with my daughter on friday night because of sooomuch trafic, the taxi would have taken hours, the metro took us 15 min, and nobody bother us , but a nice coulpe help us with our stop, you just say the Carrousel and capacyty shopping center (which are in the same block as the hotel) and they tell you .

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you want to be close to Istanbul airport”
Reviews.Author: SydneyPearl
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice if you are looking for a hotel close to the airport, which is wanted I wanted for 1 night. It cost us 15TL in a taxi ride and took about 10mins (whereas the hotel shuttle bus was quoted at 7.5 Euro per person - go figure!!). It is in a nice area and only about a 10 minute walk from the water. Our room was pleasant and comfortable with all the mod cons. Only drawback would be the shower which is located in the bath. It was a big step to get in and out of it. OK for us but wouldn't be for the elderly or disabled. the door on the shower was also awkward. The breakfast buffet was splendid with a fine choice of hot and cold options. We had dinner in the restaurant on the top of the hotel which had spectacular views of the Marmara sea and Istanbul. The restaurant food was adequate and OK priced for a hotel (when converted to dollars). As mentioned in other reviews the hotel is right next to two large shopping malls. I tried to book a room through its website which had some special rates and the booking page constantly failed to work, so ended booking by email but at a cost of 20 euro more. The final price was more than I wanted to pay but for the convenience to the airport and the amenities it was worth it. I really recommend this hotel if you want to avoid staying in Sultanahmet and want to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - bad location”
Reviews.Author: Dori-DD
Reviews.Content: 1. We booked this hotel through an agent in Istanbul and we got a good offer for a 4 star hotel. It is very close to the airport and the taxi charged us less than 15 lira. However, the hotel is located quite far from other places and city and you will have to take a taxi and pay quite a lot. However, we were aware of this fact when we booked the hotel, and as we have travelled quite extensively, we took the train/metro to the city and it was not so bad â€“ although you would have to travel for about 40 minutes to go to the city. You need to walk for about 5 minutes and people there were very helpful. We even took the bus once to the hotel â€“ just for the fun of it. The good part of the location was that it was not in the touristic part and therefore, you get to mingle with the local crowd. The hotel is located right next to many malls and we did some great shopping. There are also a variety of restaurants and we usually took our dinner or lunch over there. We informed the hotel that we would be checking in early, but the rooms were not ready when we arrived. We had to spend some time in the mall and then in the reception area. The rooms are quite spacious and it looks like the photos they have posted in the internet. The staff were not that great and they did not go out of their way to help. Most of them did not speak English and they looked stressed and whenever we asked a question, they did not respond properly. The breakfast was good â€“ though it was the same everyday and there was no variety. Most of the customers were there on business. I believe, we were the only tourists who were staying at the hotel. Overall, the hotel is good if you are on business or if you are willing to spend a lot on transportation. If the hotel, was located within the city, then we would certainly stay here again. However, the transportation is a bit of an inconvenience. Otherwise, the rooms are great and as it is close to many malls â€“ it is a good place to go shopping as well.

Reviews.Title: “A "TITANIC" HOSPITALITY”
Reviews.Author: maki777
Reviews.Content: I've spent a whole month in this hotel and have no words to describe its Staff kindness and readiness to meet your requests and needs. They do it with charm and if you tip them its fine if you don't you will get a smile anyway. Hotel location is very cosy, close to the Airport and port, having couple of modern shopping centers next to it. Walking distance to the pedestrian only street where you can shop, eat and have night entertainment. Hotel restaurant on the top is giving you not only delicious food but fantastic overlook of Istanbul, Bosfor and Asian side of Istanbul. Rooms are nice, clean with new furniture, wardrobes are just good enough for short stay in standard room. If you are staying longer and if you are with your partner then you definitlly need to pay for bigger room. In standard rooms a TV is mounted on the side wall, looks nicely but it is difficult to watch from bed. This is the only set back for Titanic Port Hotel I can think off so I RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL WITH ALL MY HEART.

Reviews.Title: “New and comfortable Hotel located in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Storyteller18
Reviews.Content: Most of our local business partners had not heard of this hotel as it was new .It is located in one of the main shopping areas of Istanbul . A little off the sea but if you stay on higher floor , you can watch the ships in sea of marmara .Rooms are reasonably sized and comfortable .the breaksfast buffet is continental and arranged in a spacious restaurant .Service is definately fast and staff respond well . There is a fitness centre , swimming pool and massage centre .Some of the main shopping malls are within the vicinity of hotel . A ferry station is within walking distance .overall the hotel is luxirously furnished and one can enjoy a comfortable stay there .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AngelaDickens
Reviews.Content: I can't fault this hotel really. We were only there for one night (in transit),but they gave us a fabulous, sea-view room with magnificent views over the Bosphorus. The staff are friendly and very eager to help. I had a meal at the bar which was fantastic. The gym and turkish bath facilities are quite amazing! I wish we could have stayed longer to make proper use of them! I guess the only downside is the hotel is not ideally located within walking distance of the main tourist attractions in Istanbul...it is in a very nice area though, and there's a very nice shopping mall next door. It only took us 10 minutes from the airport,and that cost 15 Lira.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Excellent Quality”
Reviews.Author: IsmailAslan
Reviews.Content: I strongly suggest Titanic Port Otel both for business and Leisure travellers. Location is perfect and the service quality is one of the best I have seen. Rooms are clear and well decorated. Ismail Aslan

Reviews.Title: “hospitality of all staff and the quality of all hotel facilities”
Reviews.Author: abutlal
Reviews.Content: TITANIC PORT HOTEL - ISTANBUL BAKIRKOY is the warm-hearted reception and hospitality of the hotel management, and it is my favorite hotel for business or leisure travelis, it is convenient and comfortable hotel for those who need to visit istanbul the city of a lot of fun, completely safe, and it's easily accessible by ferry, boat , bus, or train to see the heritage and tradition of ottoman and next to a mall & shoppâ€™s and near to the airport ,

HotelInfo.Name: Titanic Port Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Fisekhane Cd. No.7/3 | Bakirkoy, Istanbul 34140, Turkey
